0P00000GDW.L.long_name: Herald Worldwide Technology Fund Class A
0P00000GDW.L.summary: The fund seeks to achieve capital growth, in excess of the average, by investing in quoted companies in the technology, communication and multi-media sectors. As its name suggests, the fund invests in companies worldwide, but especially the UK and North America.
0P00000GDW.L.manager_bio: Katie Potts is the Managing Director and lead fund manager for Herald Investment Management Limited (âHeraldâ). Katie established Herald in December 1993 to manage the Herald Investment Trust plc, which was launched in February 1994. In April 1998, Herald launched the Herald Worldwide Technology Fund. Katie read Engineering Science on a GKN Group scholarship at Lady Margaret Hall, Oxford, and then worked for five years as an analyst and fund manager at Baring Investment Management Limited, before joining S.G. Warburg Securitiesâ UK electronics research team in 1988. The team was consistently voted top team in the Extel survey of analysts in the sector, and she was voted top analyst by finance directors of electronics companies canvassed by the Treasurer magazine. In addition Katie had responsibility within S.G. Warburgâs UK research department for commenting on accounting issues.

0P00000RFE.L.short_name: Close FTSE TechMark Fund A Acc
0P00000RFE.L.long_name: Close FTSE TechMark Fund A Acc
0P00000RFE.L.summary:
The Fund aims to track the FTSE techMARK Focus Index (the âIndexâ) performance in capital terms. 
 The FTSE techMARK Focus Index is based on the performance of the stocks comprised in the FTSE techMARK All-Share but excludes stocks issued by very large companies. The Fund aims to achieve its objective by investing principally in shares comprised in the techMARK market, for the purpose of tracking the Index as closely as possible.

0P00006AER.TW.long_name: Eastspring Investments US High Tech Fund
0P00006AER.TW.summary: The fund aims to achieve risk diversification and long-term capital growth by investing in companies involved in telecommunication, software and hardware, electronics, internet, semiconductor, multi-media, biotechnology, special chemical products, drugs, healthcare, environmental protection and high-quality materials, as well as companies benefited by investing in these high-tech companies.

0P00006AHF.TW.summary: The fund seeks long-term capital appreciation through investments in securities listed on stock exchanges of Taiwan, Japan, Korea, Hong Kong, and Singapore, and OTC Exchange of Taiwan.

0P00006AJJ.TW.summary: The fund achieves a spread of risk and seeks long-term capital appreciation through investments in technology related stocks that listed or traded on the Taiwan Stock Exchange and OTC exchange.

0P00006Q06.SI.long_name: Eastspring Investments Unit Trusts - Global Technology Fund
0P00006Q06.SI.summary: The investment objective of the PRU Global Technology Fund is to maximise long-term total returns through investment in equities and equity-related securities of companies around the world with innovative products, processes or services. These investments include, but are not restricted to, those companies whose provision or use of technology give them a strategic advantage in the market.

PHSVQ.MI.long_name: Pharus SICAV - Next Revolution Class Q EUR Acc
PHSVQ.MI.summary: The Portfolio's investment objective is to achieve long term capital growth, by investing in UCITS and/or other UCIs whose main purpose is to invest in a broad range of asset classes such as equities, government bonds, high yield bonds, floating rate notes, financial derivate instruments, cash and cash equivalents. The underlying funds will be mainly characterized by medium-low volatility and they can be denominated in a currency other than the base currency of the Fund. The asset allocation in funds whose main purpose is to invest in emerging markets will not exceed the upper limit of 30%.
